page.title: 16TRANSPORT. S CREAKE
page.content: The people of the village depend on private cars for personal transport. The nearest railway station is 25 miles away. There is one bus weekly to Fakenham and one to Kings Lynn. The latter, and Norwich, are out of reach of those who do not have a car. There is a taxi service, based on Fakenham for those who can afford it. The elderly with no car, are least able to meet this cost. They rely on the goodwill of neighbours for visits to Burnham Market Surgery, and shopping in County towns. A Community bus service, manned by volunteers, has started to operate in the Wells-Walsingham-Fakenham area. Each amateur driver has passed a driving test for a Public Service Vehicle. It remains to be seen if this service will be successful.
